Hello and welcome to the Auckland Blood Bowl Federation!This is the club page for our long running Blood Bowl league.
We run two leagues per year, starting in late Jan and finishing in early Dec. Each season consists of 2-3 preseason builder rounds, 7-8 rounds of the regular season and 1-2 playoff rounds.
Our league nights are from 6pm to 9pm on every 2nd Thursday, graciously hosted at Hobbymaster 531 Great South Road, Penrose
title: Welcome to the ABBF

Season 1 2024 Final ResultsSeason 1 2024 has wrapped up and its time to celebrate our deserving (and undeserving), winners.
First of all, congratulations to our Grand Final winner and League Champion: Evert Jan Loef with his Khorn team ALL THE RAGE!
Despite suffering a setback early in the season against Kharaka Killfrenzy, another Khorn team, ALL THE RAGE went through the season as the only undefeated team, finishing on 7 wins and 2 draws.

7s League 2023-2024 Final ResultsCongratulations to our Sevens Grand Final winner and League Champion: Isaac Jeffares with his Devil Rats!
The Cup Grand Final was played between Abyssal Kraken BBFC (Dark Elves) and the Devil Rats (Skaven). In what had threatened to be a close game, the Skaven team won with a decisive 2-0 victory (1-0 cas) over the Dark Elves.
After an early advantage, the Dark Elves could not capitalise on some early crowd surf opportunities and the Skaven went in for an easy 1 TD lead.

The ABBF proudly presents the inaugural Auckland Summer Sevens Tournament On January 27th 2024 we will be hosting our first annual Blood Bowl Sevens tournament, as part of the NZ Blood Bowl Sevens Circuit, and in association with Hobbymaster NZ.
Come and join us for four rounds of sevens Blood Bowl in this NAF sanctioned one-day event.
Sevens is the exciting and dynamic shorter form of Nuffle’s great game and is the perfect way to introduce new players to the Blood Bowl.

Season 2 2023 Final ResultsCongratulations to our Grand Final winner and League Champion: Evert Jan Loef with the Humerus Laughing Stock!
The Cup Grand Final was played between Humerus Laughing Stock and The Eight Peaks Warlords. The game went into Extra Time after ending 1-1 in regulation time. The whole game was played in pouring rain, and really could have gone either way. Bomber Dribblesnot was induced to play for the Warlords and after an indifferent 1st half, really put in work during the 2nd Half and in over time.
title: Season 2 2023 Final Results

subtitle:
The Powtearoa Provincial Championship 2023 On the weekend of the 2nd and 3rd of Dec 2023, Wellington hosted the first bi-annual, Powtearoa Provincial Championship (PPC). This was a team’s tournament with players representing (most) of the Blood Bowl playing regions of NZ.
There were 10 teams of 4 players each, for 40 players in total, and it was contested in 5 games over the two days.
The teams were: Auckland, Hawkes Bay, Bay of Plenty, Manawatu, Kapiti, Wellington, Christchurch, and three conglomerate teams of stragglers (or folks that couldn’t find numbers to fill a full regional team): Barbarians, Wellington B, and the Rejects.
title: The Powtearoa Provincial Championship 2023

Welcome to the first ABBF 7s league!The ABBF is pleased to announce our first ever 7s League. Blood Bowl 7s is a quick and exciting variant of Blood Bowl, played by 7 players per side, on a smaller pitch. It is great for shorter games and is a perfect way to introduce new or younger players to the game.
We will be running a 6 game season with 2 games of playoffs, for 8 games in total.
title: 7s League 2023 - 2024

subtitle:
Blood Bowl 7s is coming to the ABBF!This summer, during the off season, the ABBF will be running our first ever 7’s League and Tournament and we could not be more excited!
Blood Bowl 7’s is a shorter variant of Nuffle’s Great Game, with teams of 7 a side playing 6 turns halves on a smaller Blood Bowl pitch. It makes for fast and dynamic games that play in under an hour and are an excellent way to introduce new players.
title: Blood Bowl 7s Is Coming!

subtitle:
The ABBF proudly presents The Greenstone Cup 2023 The ABBF proudly hosted the 2023 Greenstone cup on 16 and 17 September 2023, at the excellent Maukau Cruising Club, Onehunga. Right on the shores of the Manukau harbour.
This year we had 16 coaches battling it out over 5 rounds, with players travelling from Hawkes Bay, Tauranga and Wellington.
Congratulations to Andrew MacKenzie from Wellington for taking out the tournament with his Black Orcs: Jungle Boogaloo.
title: Green Stone Cup 2023
